Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Bill O
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for two nights while trying to find our son a play to live. The front desk employees were great, they went over and above to help with anything they could. We were always greeted with a smile. Everyone was so nice and Holiday Inn is lucky to have very dedicated staff. We will be coming back in a few months and are going to be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Ge1805
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews I was very unsure of my decision to stay here and was a little nervous to arrive. Upon arriving we was greeted by an extremely friendly and informative front desk clerk! Our room was perfect size for us and our stay( mini king suite) and price was good also(70 per night) breakfast was great for a free breakfast. We slept great the bed was so comfortable!! I would definitely stay here again! Yes, the motel building is a little out dated but overall I had a very relaxing and enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good HI Express”
Reviews.Author: zhuskers1
Reviews.Content: Great location id you are going to attend the shows. Breakfast area can be a little crowded. Rooms average for a HI Express

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: earthbisket
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel in advance for my wife and two children. When I arrived and checked into room there was one king bed. Went back to the desk and they said they had one room left with two queens but it was a smoking room. We took the room which was in the basement. When we got to the basement all the carpet was ripped out in the hallways and it smelled of mildew. We did not stay. Would expect more from holiday inn.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: krace168
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with our recent overnight stay at this hotel. It was a packed hotel that weekend. Breakfast on Sunday at 9am was a long, long line. However, food kept coming. The walls are really thin in this hotel. The location right off Hwy 76 is very convenient. It is a hop and skip to the Tanger outlets and lots of other attractions and restaurants. The hotel room could have been cleaner in terms of surfaces. We found a dime-sized spider hanging from our towel as we reached out to use it. Upon our notifying the front desk, the immediately sent clean towels. I would stay here again because of price, location, convenience and the super-friendly staff. We requested a late checkout which was happily granted. It makes a difference to have a great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Ummmmm”
Reviews.Author: LinGal2001
Reviews.Content: I happened on this one just for a place to sleep and that's about all I would use it for. What can I say, it's a Holiday Inn in Branson. If you are going to Branson to see shows and want a nice hotel as part of your experience and price isn't your only consideration keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service”
Reviews.Author: sylvia j
Reviews.Content: this hotel is manned by the best staff anywhere---i am a tour guide for a travel company---i stayed in this hotel 4 times in 6 wks and they consistantly gave the best service possible, from the front desk, luggage carriers, breakfast staff and room service---5 stars +++++---just couldn't get any better tks, sylvia janes

Reviews.Title: “Good as usual”
Reviews.Author: bagladygee
Reviews.Content: We travel to Branson often and usually stay somewhere from VRBO, but if your coming for a quick trip and don't want to hassle with paying a cleaning fee I would recommend staying here. The service is good, the rooms clean and you can't beat the location for Branson. It is about midway on the strip, close to the outlet malls and next door do Walmart & Jubilee Grocery. They offer a free hot breakfast that was well stocked.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: epresley142
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Holiday Inns in my travels because of the high standards they have.I was disappointed with the quality of this hotel. We were with a tour group, so the choice was not ours. Our bathroom was not the cleanest. I understand this is an older hotel, but cleanliness is not an option! The sink had toothpaste on it, and the bathroom door was spattered with a large amount of dried soap. We didn't have an ironing board, or a working alarm clock. So I left a note for the housekeeper, but it wasn't acknowledged. So I took my complaints to the front desk, and was told the housekeepers don't speak English. They did give me a different alarm clock, but it took a couple of days to get an ironing board. I did speak to the manager, and showed him in an empty room, just what my concern was about the dirty doors. That empty room also had the soap splatter. He said his housekeepers are "top-notch, and he stands behind them." He did offer to send a housekeeper to my room. The hotel has one computer for the guests, but the keyboard was very dirty. I asked the housekeeper to clean it, and she said she would as soon as she could. Didn't see it happen. Not everything was disappointing. A breakfast is offered each morning, and the hotel is in a good location. But I will stay somewhere else if I visit Branson again. I will not recommend it to friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “Another great HI Express experience”
Reviews.Author: Ossie50
Reviews.Content: Our room at this hotel was nice, quiet and clean (non-smoking). We really enjoyed the ground level (1st floor) pool side seating area directly outside our room. The continental breakfast was also good and was served from 6:30 to 9 am each morning, on the 3rd floor near the hotel lobby. There was a large pool and an enclosed hot tub with a beautiful mountain view. Our room had 2 queen beds, coffee pot and hair dryer. There was no refrigerator or microwave in the room. There were suites available, that probably included the appliances. The hotel is located on Hwy 76, next to Walmart and within walking distance of some shows and is near the entrance to Tanger mall. The only complaint that we had was that the air conditioner was under the window and would cut off before the far side of the room was as cool as we would have liked. It would have been nice to have had a thermostat on the far inside wall to control the temperature.

Reviews.Title: “Best Friends Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Diane W
Reviews.Content: Your hotel was a wonderful place to say for our week of vacation. Clean rooms, great food and wonderful helpful staff. Cheerful and happy people to start your day with. We all had an awesome time in your amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Staff”
Reviews.Author: coffeemug
Reviews.Content: We had reserved a family suite and one double queen bed in close proximity to each other--both non-smoking. When we arrived, we found a terrible smoke smell in the double queen. The family suite was fresh and nicely done. We called the front desk to "complain" and were told that they would see what they could do about it. They used a room spray that is to remove smells and offered the sprayed room or another room down the hall a bit. We asked about moving a roll away into the family suite. They would have allowed that also, but did caution us that the pull out sofa would not be very comfortable for an adult. We opted for the room down the hall. While this wasn't ideal, it worked for us. While the property is not new, it was very comfortable and clean. The breakfast offered a nice variety of choices (scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs, sausage patties, biscuits and gravy, oatmeal, cold cereals, toast, bagels, English muffins, pancakes, yogurt, milk, juices and coffee, and HI's signature cinnamon buns.) Staff is constantly restocking food items . . . right up to the close of the breakfast. The beds and bedding were some of the most comfortable we have experienced at hotels. Most impressive to us were the beds and the staff. They did everything they could to make us comfortable and correct the room problem we had. They shared information about shows and dining options and all in all . . . just plain took good care of us!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: ohXbliss
Reviews.Content: I love the staff here, Rich was so helpful and kind to help us find the best places to eat while in Branson. I will definitely stay here next time we come to Branson- and recommend this place to all our friends and family!!

Reviews.Title: “Standard, not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: lv2g0
Reviews.Content: The location was great. If you stay here, use the back road to avoid the traffic on 76. Or walk! We had 2 adults and 2 kids staying in a standard queen room. We were on the fifth floor with a balcony overlooking the front of the hotel. Our room was quiet. The room was quite small with barely enough room to walk around the beds. The beds were very firm (uncomfortable for me). The bathroom was very small. Our room always seemed warm/humid, even with AC running. Having the balcony was nice, but there are other hotels in Branson that offer the same room or larger for a better price. Everything was clean and smelled fresh when we arrived. Breakfast is a hot mess. Disorganized and crowded. The workers at breakfast were really working hard to keep food out and the tables clean. The pool and hot tub area were clean. I probably wouldn't stay here again, not because it was terrible, I just think there are better values in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: julyjeff98
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you can get the right rooms. All have balconies but some baclonies on the front side of the hotel (which is actualy the 3rd floor) is ground level with the entrance and parking lot. Lots of traffic. If you can get a room on any floor that has a pool view, you will be very happy. I was using holiday inn points for my stay and I first got a crappy room (you always do using points) so I ask to be changed, He was very courtious about it and put me ground level room with a pool view. We had a great time and the free breakfast is huge. (not just coffee and doughnuts). They even have a machine that when you push the button, you get two perfect pancakes in less than two minutes. The lady who runs the breakfast is very nice and will do anything to help.

Reviews.Title: “FIND ANOTHER HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: JereN4
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with our 2 grand children and asked for a pool-side room. The room was VERY cramped for 4 people. To get to the pool, we still had to go around the fence and enter through the gate on the other side of the pool. The door to the "patio" area was hard to lock. The "patio" area had not been cleaned up...napkins, beer can, etc. The Roman shade on the door was all torn up and couldn't be raised and we couldn't open the window curtains either. The bathroom was not as clean as it should be and the door stuck. When I complained, the desk clerk (and I think the manager) were very courteous and offered us a suite. We moved everything into the suite. It was clean, although the curtains also were almost impossible to pull open and the bathroom smelled like mildew (I think it was the shower curtain). The children went swimming and when we were taking showers to go out, the bath tub wouldn't drain. The maintainance man had already left, but they called him at home. I was sorry to pull him from family. The beds were comfortable. The furnighings were very worn and dated, but clean. The staff was very nice and helpful and did the best they could with the aged, dated hotel. I believe this hotel just needs a complete make-over. Because of the hastle of moving, and things not working, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bpmitchell
Reviews.Content: The room was an ordinary hotel room. Nothing special. Beds were very uncomfortable, the hallway was noisey and the room was very bright because the shade for the balcony door didn't come all the way down. I've stayed in cheaper rooms in Branson that were much better or the same quality. I was expecting more for more money. The breakfast was good!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in town”
Reviews.Author: llamamamaof2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with kids and a friend and her child. We used points to book here and were upgraded to a suite on check in!! This is an older hotel but everything was clean. The room was really big and had a seperate bedroom area. There was a balcony that ran the length of the room. Breakfast was good and the woman working there made sure to let us know she had donuts for the kids. We were not in the room much but it was great a great base to visit the Christmas stuff at Silver Dollar City.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected.”
Reviews.Author: RalphSmiley
Reviews.Content: was there this past weekend and on checking in I had to wait for clerk at desk to complete his phone call to a local food establishment ordering his dinner and then continue to complain while on the phone about his bad service the last time he ordered. Once checked in we found that our room was without a Balcony on the west side. With the hotel non smoking this was an issue for my wife who had to walk down stairs and outside to smoke. The hotel was full and you could hear the neighbors next door. Overall the room was clean and functional due to the location on the strip. The staff who maintained the breakfast was overwhelmed due to the volume of people but they did a good job considering. the layout of the breakfast area needs to be looked at to improve the flow and service of breakfast. We wouldn't stay there again unless we had a room with a balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: beth c
Reviews.Content: I have waited a while before reviewing this hotel, because I had filled out a survey for Holiday Inn on this hotel and asked that I be contacted by their manager, but since I haven't been, i will review it. We are priority club members, so I thought that we were to be given bottled water on check-in, and a morning paper. we were kept awake by so much noise in the next room and the hall, also the construction area was bad, the back parking area seemed a bit unsafe, but the worst part was the hair in my husbands scrambled eggs. He didn't say anything about it because the 2 ladies working in the breakfast area were so nice and he didn't want either of them to get blamed. If we are ever in Branson again, we will pick a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel and we'll be back for sure.”
Reviews.Author: smproulx
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights for a mini-vacation renting two rooms. We arrived an hour before check in time and our rooms were not ready. Instead of making us wait we both were upgraded into the larger suites. The hotel has been remodeled and the decorating is lovely. The rooms, exercise room, pool area are very clean. A hot breakfast is available every morning and the food is great!!!!!. What sets this hotel apart from others I've stayed at is that the staff is so friendly and accomodating. There is a on-site manager who is very "hands on" and makes sure that the hotels guests are satisfied at all times. I would highly recommend this hotel. It is also a very good value and the beds are really comfortable. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “OK but noisy”
Reviews.Author: luv2scrapcmc
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and staff was very friendly. However, my room on the 3rd floor (lobby floor) was noisy - close to lobby, elevator, and ice machine. Wouldn't have been bad if I could have left the fan on the the AC to drown out noise; however, you could not run the AC and leave the fan on. If you turn on the AC, it goes to automatic and therefore the fan cuts on and off. Asked at the front desk, but they had no solutions.

Reviews.Title: “Hiden Surprise”
Reviews.Author: ivawms
Reviews.Content: We live an hour from Branson, but it is our favorite vacation spot. We have driven past this hotel many times and didn't notice it. It is behind Shoney's. We had a double queen suite. Our suite was very large and quiet. We enjoyed the view from our balcony. We had no problems getting in or out from Hwy 76. We could have comfortably had more guests in our room without feeling cramped. They had a full breakfast included with the room. Branson has such a variety of things to do, you can have many different vacations in the same town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravelor5
Reviews.Content: All was good. The staff super friendly and helped us with shows and attractions. The location was great to adventure both ends of the strip with minimal traffic hassels.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: joedavis0001
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Thursday night to employees talking loudly down the hallways. There were not many people staying in the hotel from what we could see. I forgot supplies at home, and as I waited at the front desk for 5 minutes before the manager finally came to the front desk to help me. Breakfast was a joke. The same people that were cleaning my room/ toilette was also the ones helping to serve the food without gloves on. The eggs were ice cold and rubber tasting. There was no coffee and the one other breakfast person had her greasy tied loosly back hair touched the food. I asked for hot coffee and she acted like I was asking for gold. She was half my age and I must say though the room was clean. I have stayed at holiday inn for many years and have never had a experience such as this.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break”
Reviews.Author: Aquariuz
Reviews.Content: My wife wanted to go to Branson for Spring Break. I had never been and I agreed to go with her and our 14 year old son. I am a Platinum member of the ICH rewards program so I am used to the brand. I reserved a room with two queen beds with a porch next to the pool, online. We got a suite with two rooms, one king sized bed, a jacuzzi and a couch with a fold out bed. The 14 year old was excited to have his own room, so we didn't complain. The room was dated, it could have been straight out of the 70's with a 1980 TV set in both rooms. We did have a microwave and a refrigerator in our room. The hotel was renovating the first floor but apparently they started at the bottom and intend to work up. We were in room 221, if they put you in that room ask to be moved immediately. It was the loudest room I have ever stayed in. The elevator is on one wall, the housekeeping closet is on another and all water movement is audible in the walls. Normally in a loud hotel I run the fan on the A/C as a white noise and it sometimes helps. Not in this room, I think we froze up the A/C it went off and on all night. The internet was free and wireless. SO I finally used my laptop, went on to youtube and found a video of a waterfall that I played on a loop. That kind of worked. The breakfast buffet was nice. Scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, toast, pastries, juices. But the room was chaos. The attendants were scrambling trying their best to fill up the food, they seemed kind of harried and brusque. The pool was empty, so the porch was less interesting than it might be at other times. Walmart is right across the street, Taco Bell directly in front, along with Shoneys restaurant and a TCBY yogurt shop. Getting in and out of this location can also be challenging with all the traffic stopped on the road in front of the hotel. Learn how to use the back road in and out of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: rusavedbyjesus
Reviews.Content: We would recommend the inn our stay was excellent the help were met you needs . The rooms were nice and we enjoyed our time there. plan on making next year to branson also. Yours truly Loyd janet Marilyn Lillian

Reviews.Title: “Excellent handicap service!”
Reviews.Author: jwsproul
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at this wonderful hotel during the recent blizzard. My wife, who is wheel-chair bound, of course requires a property with extremely handicap friendly ammenities. This hotel couldn't have fit the bill better! From the moment we parked in the very accessible parking, the staff could not have been more obliging. Our room was handicap fitted with a roll in shower-perfect! Knowing we required extra attention the staff went out of their way to make us comfortable and make sure our needs were met! We would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: larry710-11
Reviews.Content: Great service, clean rooms, hot and tasty free breakfast, staff was great

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms and comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: apn12
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my sister, mother and niece (10 year old). Room was clean, nicely decorated/furnished. We requested a roll-away in our 2 queen bed room. I was initially wary since it really could not be reserved, but one was available on arrival. Arrived late evening and the man on duty at check-in was extremely nice/helpful; he went directly to our room, set-up the cot and even put the sheets on it for us! My niece was disappointed that the pool was outside (wasn't a priority for us since we came to see the Christmas lights/shop/sight-see). The hot-tub was inside but I can't comment since we didn't have time to use it. Area for breakfast could have been bigger; had to wait in line and hard to get a table, food was hot but an upgrade to a better brand of coffee would be an excellent addition.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: bobkat45
Reviews.Content: Our room was not clean. The A/C was so dirty, I turned it off so it wouldn't be blowing the filth around the room. The window track had a year's worth of dead bugs in it. Room was very cramped and there were just two of us. Used Priorty Club points for this stay so at least there was no cost. Also, Priority Club is the worst of the points clubs, but that is another review. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Great location, nice rooms, highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: sandrs
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my twin 11 year old girls in a double queen room. Beds were very comfortable and the room was immaculate. We overlooked the pool (which my kids loved and it too was very well kept.) but there was minimal to no noise from the pool below and the view was nice. Free wi-fi, and breakfast buffet which made our visit convenient. We were cloe to the Branson strip and many popular attractions, check in and out speedy and efficient, plenty of close parking, restaurant next door. Can't ask for more and I would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “A very good Holiday Inn Express to relax with family”
Reviews.Author: cowboys61
Reviews.Content: The front desk clerks were very friendly, clean, spoke where you could understand them. The service and cleanness of the hotel and rooms were very good. The hot breakfast was very good and hot. Good slections to choose from. I recommend this hotel to anyone. We will stay there again. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed :(”
Reviews.Author: Ricky075
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Hotel and Suites in Branson, Missouri several times for more than 5 years. For many years, this used to be a good place to stay. Not anymore! The hotel rooms are in need of a major renovation. They do not even have flat screen televisions. The carpeting in the room was worn and dirty. . . my white socks turned brown after walking on the filthy carpeting. A musty smell throughout the hotel leads one to question the cleanliness of the property. The fitness room is a joke with sub-par equipment. The swimming pool was overrun with unruly and unsupervised children. Guest room bath is very tiny and not modern. Hotel front desk staff members have no customer service skills and need to take a basic course in customer service. The breakfast area was filthy and there was very little food selection when I arrived for breakfast after 9am. The only good ting this hotel has going for it is location right off the 76 Strip. However, there are too many other choices for lodging in Branson that are more reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: geander
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times and I think this was the best. The hotel was clean and the staff was great. They were willing to meet your every need with a great attitude. The breakfast in the morning was very good. When you asked about the area the staff was very well informed. I would suggest this hotel if you are going to Branson, MO for a stay. You could not find a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodations and service”
Reviews.Author: covenantx
Reviews.Content: Excellent room and room service, excellent location, helpful and friendly staff. My room was beyond my request, spacious and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Mom's Birthday”
Reviews.Author: JoW1973
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Holiday Inn Express on Green Mtn Drive in Branson with our family all coming from diffrent parts of the U.S. and when we got there it was as usual VERY clean (even with construction for the indoor pool area ) going on it was CLEAN andd the staff was VERY helpful and friendly . The young gentle man in the breakfast area (Felix ) was the BEST he was GREAT with all 8 of there drinking coffee and talking he made us feel VERY at HOME .It was all GREAT but Felix REALLY made it a GREAT stay in the hotel . Thank You again for making Mom's 80th birthday a GREAT trip !

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: DenaVecchetti
Reviews.Content: We really appreciated the staff they were always friendly & ready to answer any questions we had, they gave great advise on things to do for all ages in our group. We had a group of 9 with all ages from 5 to 43. The free breakfast was amazing so much more than we expected. I really like how centrally located it is walking distance to so many things.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GinaMo76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn over Easter Weekend. The staff was very friendly and involved in helping find fun things for my kids to do. The breakfast was hot and delicious. It looks as if they are updating many aspects of the hotel. The rooms are roomy for a family of five. We will definetly be staying here again. It is a great location in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel ,great breakfast, nice clean rooms and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ash39
Reviews.Content: We had family come into town and we decided to get a suite . The rooms were very nice and comfortable. All the staff was very friendly and helpful with everything. The breakfast was wonderful and are experience was great. We will for sure stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK....”
Reviews.Author: areick
Reviews.Content: The hotel seems to have fallen into disrepair in some places: halls were dirty, spare furniture in halls that is broken, smells odd, hot tub not working, dead plants in hot tub area. Entry to the hotel is nice and breakfast room is nice. Workout room has old equipment in it and an empty water cooler. The suite we stayed in was roomy, but not very well kept, either. The shower rod was falling off, jacuzzi was not clean, dirty carpets, dirty shower curtains. The staff was VERY friendly, HOWEVER, there was one older lady who worked on the breakfast staff who was VERY rude. It did not happen to me personally , but I heard her be rude to several other people during my 4 night stay. One was a CHILD- she said " Move or you will get burned with this gravy!" I couldn't believe it!! She also stood behind the GUESTS and huffed and puffed when they didn't see her there. She was unbelievably rude in the way she eyeballed what people were eating and the attitude she showed. Terrible for someone who is there to SERVE the guests who pay hundreds of dollars to stay there. Overall, the hotel was average, with wonderful front desk ladies and maintenance people.

Reviews.Title: “I was charged $300.00 for smoking in room, but I didn't smoke.”
Reviews.Author: LittleRockMad
Reviews.Content: My wife, brother in law and sister in law stayed at this holiday inn express on July 25, 2009. We stayed in room 440 and 442. I paid for both rooms. When I called to get reservations I asked for rooms either side by side or across from each other. They said, It is taken care of and gave me two confirmation numbers. When we checked in they gave us rooms on two different floors. My wife would not have that so she complained and they gave us rooms across the hall from each other. Things were fine after that with one exception. I was viewing my bank account on line several days later noticing the two $118.00 fees that were billed to my account. Then I saw three (3) $100.00 charges deducted from my account ($300.00). I called the holiday in manager to inquire about the obvious mistake. She told me it was for smoking fees and told me that we smoked in the rooms. "We did not smoke". I asked her why there were three fees. She said I stayed in three rooms; 440, 442 and 444. She said she found cigarette butts. I informed her that I did not even stay in room 444. She insisted that I did. She finally said she will credit $100.00 for room 444. It is now August 3, 2009 and I still haven't received credit for the room I was supposed to have smoked in that I didn't even stay in and was not billed for. If you smoke and carry cigarettes in a shirt pocket please don't use the express check out at this hotel. Check out in person and make them go look at the room you are checking out of. I called Holiday Inns corporate offices to discuss with them. Their hands are tied and they can not override a decision of the hotel. I am sure the profits at this holiday Inn are up, at least the Managers profits are up. I retired from a company where the CUSTOMER is always right. I did not smoke in my room and I feel like holiday inn stole $300.00 from me.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Stay-Will not Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: sandy2004a
Reviews.Content: Never again. Stayed on a reward stay, so no complaint about rates. We had made advance reservations, and the only reward room available was for 2 queens. On arrival, we asked if a king was available, and one was, but was not ready. We were asked to come back later in the day, and the room would be ready. Once we got to the room, 2058, it was so tiny, the only mirror was in the bath, also tiny. The room had been created by spliting a suite, making 2 separate rooms. No closet in the bed room, just an open area with a hanging bar in it. One lounge chair was jammed into a corner, and lost a leg as we tried to move it. We had just witnessed two very large groups checking in, and knew other rooms were not available from conversations overheard at the front desk. By this time, we were very tired, and my husband did not want to go to the trouble of making a move, so we stayed put. Breakfast was standard. Basic Holiday Inn Express. Talked wtih the desk clerk at checkout about our room.. She apologized.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HollieBOklahoma
Reviews.Content: Four teachers having a great time was the reason for our visit! This was a great place to stay. Our hot breakfast was great each morning and it was free! The hotel staff ,including maintenance, were all very friendly and went out of their way to help make our four night stay enjoyable. The hotel has been recently updated. It is a very clean place to stay. We stayed in suites (for the same rate as a reg. room) and they were awesome. It is located in the middle of 76 Strip so it was easy to get to the places we wanted to go to in either direction. We are going back in December and this is the place we will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Better of the two Holiday Inns in Branson”
Reviews.Author: STLcard06
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, this was the better of the two HIE's in Branson. The staff was freindlier, the room was nicer, and the location is better. There were a few problems with the room, such as AC not working properly, but the front desk took care of the problem when I told them about it. My only complaint about the hotel is that the room seemed very dimly lit. Other than that, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “So Completely NASTY”
Reviews.Author: mistale
Reviews.Content: I will never stay at any Holiday Inn again because of this experience. The hotel staff was too involved in arguing about who had more hours on the schedule than to give us decent attention when we checked in (and out-must have been a BIG discussion to last 24 hrs...) but the kicker was the dead skin flakes in the sheets when I climbed into bed at 1:30am! I was so grossed out! The woman at the front desk brought me sheets and left them on the floor outside the door-she could not leave the front desk unattended- I was speechless. NEVER AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “our time in branson”
Reviews.Author: trvl4fun08
Reviews.Content: The hotel check in time is not until 3:00pm, but the staff was very friendly and helpful allowing us to check in early since our room was clean. We booked a Jacuzzi King Suite which had two rooms. One area included the king bed with a bathroom, the other room contained a living area with a second bathroom and small kitchen area. The bathrooms looked clean and the carpet was in pretty good condition. This suite works great for a small family, we felt like we had room to stretch out. It also helped having two bathrooms and two TV's. We were slightly disappointed with the pool because it looked like it was in need of an update. We tried the "free breakfast", but found that we needed to wake up a little earlier to get the best selection. Overall, we were happy with the room for the price we paid. The hotel is located in a busy area of Branson, but there is a Wal-Mart next door along with alot of restaurant choices close by.

Reviews.Title: “Most convenient hotel in town”
Reviews.Author: Nihow
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel for our family, with great hot breakfast and comfortable room. The location is close to all shows and attractions. Very good value with the whole family, will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Suitable for families”
Reviews.Author: LovesRoomService
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we were traveling with our children, age 4 and 21 months. We wanted a hotel where our little one could take a nap during the day, without everyone else needing to take a nap. The two-room set up of this "suite" worked very well for this. You can shut the door between the two rooms. This also worked well for after the kids went to bed and my husband and I could watch a movie on our side. The continental breakfast was convienient, although monotonous. The pool was clean and my children used it several times. Our room actually looked over the pool, but did not find it to be a noise problem. Decor was fine and the room was clean, but not outstanding. The walls are thin and our neighbors were noisy, even at 4:30 in the morning. A big downside was the humidity in the room. We couldn't seem to get rid of it. It was so damp, dry paper would become damp and flimsy over night just sitting on the desk. Also, our entire floor had a musty smell that didn't go away. We saw the hotel staff cleaning the hallway carpet 4 times in the same spot and kept a fan on it 24 hours a day. That might have contributed to the smell, which did get to me after a while. I would recommend this hotel if you are traveling with young children, but not for adults traveling alone or as a couple. I normally stay at a higher quality hotel when it is just me and my husband, so I am trying to not be overly critical. I think that we will stay at the Hilton on the Landing next time our children want to go to Branson again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay & great employes & great room”
Reviews.Author: bgray10569
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this location. The staff is very friendly. They have a great breakfast bar. I have stayed in one of their suites. The suite is 2 seprate rooms with couch that makes into a bed, microwave, refrigator, talbe and chairs with a tv in oine roon. The bedroom has 2 queen size beds with a tv and a large bathroon. It is located behind Shoney's next to TcY Yougurt and Taco Bell. It is also within walking distant to walmart and the mall.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Elderly Guests!!!”
Reviews.Author: LA-Honeymooner
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights as part of our honeymoon. The hotel staff was very friendly. When we went to the continental breakfast the next morning, we were literal shoved out of the way by some elderly guests. The food was ok but not worht fighting over. If you want breakfast, there is a Starbuck's down the street.

Reviews.Title: “we hated it”
Reviews.Author: stinkerpotmom
Reviews.Content: Stay somewhere else: extremely hard beds tiny bathrooms poorly lit hallways squeaking doors and thin walls will keep you up at night high price for what you get located on strip behind Shoney's - only plus we found

Reviews.Title: “Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old and needs updating, it is on the 76 strip, with alot of eating places around, but the carpet is stained, rooms are very small, ice machine did not work the whole time we were there, so bugs were in the hall, did not see any in the room. Too much money for this old hotel, pictures made the hotel look good, but very disappointed. The pool was clean but very cold we could not hardly get into it. Breakfast was ok, if you got they early, they ended at 930am, but most of the muffins and donuts were long gone by then.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Nice Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for my husband and our two children to stay in. We stayed in a jacuzzi suite which was actually two seperate rooms with a locking door in between which allowed us some privacy. The jacuzzi was large, clean, and in the the master bedroom portion. The hotel, inculding the room was clean and modern. The hot tub/swimming pool area is in the rear of the building instead of in front on the main road like many of the other hotels. This was a plus to me.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay With Family”
Reviews.Author: JMOOREEllsinore
Reviews.Content: I went on business family came along. We booked two nights a Monday night and departed on Wednesday. While in meetings wife and kids age 2 & 4 went swimming in the outdoor pool and walked around branson site seeing. Located rigth next to the strip. I left hotel by 6:30 A.M. every morning had a great breakfast but by the time the family made their way down the hotel was just serving doughnuts. All in all a great place to stay with family!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice, but a little pricey for the suite in the off season”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean and the King suite we stayed in was nice. It had a seperate sleeping room with a jacuzzi tub, two seperate bathrooms and a seperate room with a couch that pulled out to a bed, chair and ottoman, micro and fridge and tv. The view from the balconies in the back is nice--you can see the pool and the Ozark Mountain side. For the off season, we thought the $110 a night was high, but it was still the most affordable jacuzzi suite we found. The only drawback was barking dogs--this hotel allows dogs and when we checked in there were 3 seperate rooms in our hall with barking dogs. However, by the time we returned to our room that night it was quiet. If you are going to spend a lot of time in your room during the day, you might want to avoid this hotel b/c people leave their barking dogs in the rooms and go to shows. However, if you're going to only sleep there, it is okay.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Branson
HotelInfo.Address: 1970 West Highway 76, Branson, MO 65616
